column4: use something like partition magic and you can resize the partitions w/out any kinda of destruction to the existing data
partition magic can handle ext3 and swaP?

from my experance, yes. I have used it before to resize linux and windows partitions... one thing you can do is get and install it on your windows partition, run it and do the resizing there, apply it all and reboot and alll that mess, then enjoy

I havent tried gparted and the other partition tools before, I have only really used fdisk and partition magic, I personaly really like partition magic. But if you have good workings w/ gparted or something else, let me know I would like to try out some other free tools, but am a little scared since I am not a fan of data-loss
